task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block and the target outline, approach and align the circular end-effector, execute three small leftward pushes to translate the block, verify at the target, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop robot with a circular end-effector must push a T-shaped block into a fixed target outline visible on the surface. The behavior emphasizes reliable perception of both the block and the target, conservative approach with tight alignment, and incremental pushing to reduce slip. After multiple short pushes, the system verifies that the block is within tolerance of the target and then retreats to a safe standoff. Observation and control occur at 10 Hz but are abstracted by action timeouts and repeats. No grasping is used; only planar pushing.
preconditions: Workspace clear with single T-shaped block present
End-effector height calibrated for planar pushing
Vision available for block and target detection
stepwise_plan: Detect or scan for the T block and the target
Move above the block and set orientation
Approach and align tightly to establish contact
Execute three incremental pushes leftward with short waits
Verify alignment at the target and retreat
success_criteria: Block pose overlaps target outline within ~1 cm planar tolerance
Orientation of the T aligns with the outline within acceptable yaw error
Robot retreats without disturbing the final pose
failure_and_recovery: If the block or target is not visible, perform a raster scan
If the push under- or overshoots, repeat incremental pushes
If contact is lost, re-approach and realign before pushing again
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the IsAt(target_zone) condition is satisfied or after the planned repeats and verification complete.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks if the T-shaped block is visible.
Raster scan to localize the block if not visible.
Checks if the target outline is visible.
Raster scan to localize the target if not visible.
Move above the block with a small vertical offset.
Set tool yaw; circular tip orientation is neutral.
Approach and align tightly to the block for pushing.
Planar push leftward by a short distance.
Verify alignment relative to the target zone.
Checks whether the block is at the target.
Back off to a safe standoff.

failure_modes: Block slips or rotates during push
recovery_strategy: Fallback to raster scans when not visible
Use multiple short pushes with waits
Limit retreat and re-run verification if misaligned
assumptions: Frames show a red block and blue outline, not gray/green as in instruction; metadata notes this mismatch and treats them as the same entities
Direction chosen as leftward (180Â°) based on apparent motion across frames
10 Hz frequency is informational and not directly mapped to ports
Target is a planar outline; verification done via symbolic IsAt plus an align check

expected_success_criteria: Block within ~1 cm and visually overlapping outline
No collisions or gripper contact with table beyond pushing face
